chargeHist.descr: Theft by Acquisition of a credit card

result.execSummary:
The defendant Sherise M. Howard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: Any other sentence.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Completion of Representation
Sentencing hearing on revocation on November 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Revocation Warrant, Order, and Packet on Count 1
Revocation Warrant, Order, and Packet on Count 1
Reminder Notice indicating amount due mailed to defendant.

(Case called at 11:13 AM) Defendant Sherise M. Howard in court.  Attorney Adam P Nero in court for Sherise M. Howard.  Attorney Andrew Gunderson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense indicates there is an agreement- recites the joint sentence recommendation. Victim/Witness statute complied with. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Defendant acknowledges prior convictions. Defendant pleads Guilty to Count 1- Possession of Methamphetamine as Repeater. Court accepts plea and finds the Defendant guilty. Remaining charges are dismissed and read in. Defense makes a statement. 
Court withhold sentence and orders 1 year Probation with the following conditions: AODA and follow through with recommendations. No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting. Maintain absolute sobriety. Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. Court costs. 
Court orders 8 days credit, if revoked.
Same as Complaint

records.addlTxt: Arraignment on April 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.

(Case called at 1:31 PM) Defendant Sherise M. Howard not in court or by Zoom.  Attorney Adam P Nero in court for Sherise M. Howard.  Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State is willing to wait to see if the Defendant appears.  Off the record 1:32pm - 1:49 pm. 
Case recalled at 1:49 PM. Defendant Sherise Howard appears in person. 
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. Arraignment to be scheduled with Branch 5 Judicial Assistant.
SPD Appointment - Attorney Adam Nero
Notice of Hearing, Notice of Assignment of Judge - Return to Sender, Not Deliverable as Addressed, Unable to Forward
Preliminary hearing on March 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

(Case called at 11:12 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Sherise Howard appears in custody via video conference from the Jail with Attorney Sonia Anderson. ADA Kelly Ronquist appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Warrant executed. State requests $500 cash bond- recites failures to appear. Defense requests bond continues. Court orders bond continues. 
Preliminary Hearing: 03/22/2022 at 1:30 PM.

2:30 PM case called. Defendant Sherise Howard does not appear in court or via Zoom. Attorney Matthew Kirkpatrick appears for the State of Wisconsin. State asks for a bench warrant based on non appearance- so ordered.
The Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender Services. Despite best efforts, the State Public Defender Office has not yet secured representation for this Defendant.
